intro: Armeria gaditana var. boissieriana, commonly known as the Boissier's thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features dense clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white wool. This variety is well adapted to rocky and coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
